title: Brain Imaging and Neural Data Analysis
description: Application of Active Inference to analysis of brain imaging data including fMRI, EEG, and MEG.
learning_objectives: Analyze brain imaging data using Active Inference
Model neural dynamics from imaging data
Infer connectivity patterns from neural recordings
Connect brain activity to cognitive processes

content.overview: Brain imaging techniques provide windows into neural activity and connectivity. Active Inference offers a theoretical framework for analyzing these data, predicting neural responses, and understanding how the brain implements predictive coding and free energy minimization.

electroencephalography.electrical_activity: Direct measure of neural electrical activity
electroencephalography.source_localization: Infer neural sources from scalp recordings

magnetoencephalography.magnetic_fields: Magnetic fields generated by neural currents
